text: [Music]
hi guys Laura Vitale on this episode of
Laura in the kitchen I want to show you
how to make my rice pudding this is my
standard recipe of course I mean I make
a ton of different flavors but this is
my go-to basic recipe because I always
have these ingredients on hand and it
makes the perfect rice pudding in my
opinion so before you get to the stove
let's let's go over the ingredients you
need some whole milk some arborio or
some risotto rice granulated sugar some
dark raisins cinnamon and vanilla
extract that's it now you know you
probably have these ingredients on hand
so this is a perfect way to use them
before we get so let's just go over the
stove and start cooking that's it I put
my milk into a large saucepan and I have
it over medium-high heat and it's up
coming up to a boil so now I'm going to
add in my rice I'm gonna give this a
stir I'm going to reduce the heat to
medium perfect I'm going to let this
cook for about 20 minutes or until the
rice is pretty much tender my rice has
been cooking for about 20 minutes
starting to look really great so now
we're gonna add our remaining
ingredients sugar the cinnamon check
that off from there
some vanilla if you had a vanilla bean
you could put the vanilla bean in at the
beginning when we put the rice in that
would be fantastic and this is
completely optional but I love some
raisins in there so I'm going to put
some raisins in but again that's totally
optional give this a nice stir make sure
everything's combined and I'm gonna let
this cook for about ten more minutes or
until the rice is completely cooked and
nice and soft this looks wonderful my
rice is fully cooked and those raisins
have really plumped up love that just
going to put this into a bowl now this
rice pudding is pretty much done but you
do need to let it cool overnight because
you know rice pudding is nice and
chilled and delicious but before we do
that let me give you a tip when you
cover this with plastic wrap make sure
that the plastic wrap is touching the
actual rice pudding because whenever you
make any
custard or anything with milk in it when
you cool it it forms a skin and you
don't want to do that
so by having the plastic wrap directly
on top of the rice pudding
makes prevents that from happening
that's it you still have super simple
and easy this is now this just needs a
cooler Rene but obviously this will be
the end of us because you know a little
bit tired but that's it simple and easy
perfect every time
smells divine and it's the one the
easiest the most comforting desserts
always have on hand so that's it I hope
you guys have enjoyed spending time with
me that's again this recipe nutters you
know where to go
www.laurainthekitchen.com i'll see you
next time
[Music]
this is so not how it should be done
because rice pudding is to be eaten cold
well it's just so good I would be thrown
out but in any fancy restaurant by
eating rest but oh well
